result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin W Gullo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Defendant must attend self-help meetings daily unless employed full time, and then 3 per week, and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Justin W Gullo in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Justin W Gullo in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Justin W Gullo in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Justin W Gullo in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Dr. Collins has submitted her report and she opines that the deft is now competent and parties stipulate to same. Defense also files motion to review bond.
Defense is asking that bail be reduced in 14CF315 to $5000.00 cash. If released, deft will live at Transitional Living Services on Douglas Ave. The State objects to the modification as requested citing the seriousness of the charges and the number of bail jumping charges.

BTC: The defendant is found competent by the Court. Bond modification is granted. Bond to be modified to $5000.00 cash. Conditions, as previously set, remain  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Cts 1-4: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ; Ct 5: 961.41(3g)(e)-PCS/THC; Ct 6: 961.573(1)-PDP.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
